table_description: List AWS S3 Objects in S3 buckets by bucket name.

columns.name: key
columns.description: The name that you assign to an object. You use the object key to retrieve the object.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The ARN of the AWS S3 Object.

columns.name: bucket_name
columns.description: The name of the container bucket of this object.

columns.name: last_modified
columns.description: Last modified time of the object.

columns.name: storage_class
columns.description: The class of storage used to store the object.

columns.name: version_id
columns.description: The version ID of the object.

columns.name: accept_ranges
columns.description: Indicates that a range of bytes was specified.

columns.name: body
columns.description: The raw bytes of the object data as a string. If the bytes entirely consists of valid UTF8 runes, an UTF8 is sent otherwise the bas64 encoding of the bytes is sent.

columns.name: bucket_key_enabled
columns.description: Indicates whether the object uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS)

columns.name: cache_control
columns.description: Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.

columns.name: checksum_crc32
columns.description: The base64-encoded, 32-bit CRC32 checksum of the object. This will only be present if it was uploaded with the object. With multipart uploads, this may not be a checksum value of the object.

columns.name: checksum_crc32c
columns.description: The base64-encoded, 32-bit CRC32C checksum of the object. This will only be present if it was uploaded with the object. With multipart uploads, this may not be a checksum value of the object.

columns.name: checksum_sha1
columns.description: The base64-encoded, 160-bit SHA-1 digest of the object. This will only be present if it was uploaded with the object. With multipart uploads, this may not be a checksum value of the object.

columns.name: checksum_sha256
columns.description: The base64-encoded, 256-bit SHA-256 digest of the object. This will only be present if it was uploaded with the object. With multipart uploads, this may not be a checksum value of the object.

columns.name: content_disposition
columns.description: Specifies presentational information for the object.

columns.name: content_encoding
columns.description: Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object.

columns.name: content_language
columns.description: The language the content is in.

columns.name: content_length
columns.description: Size of the body in bytes.

columns.name: content_range
columns.description: The portion of the object returned in the response.

columns.name: content_type
columns.description: A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.

columns.name: delete_marker
columns.description: Specifies whether the object retrieved was (true) or was not (false) a delete marker.

columns.name: expiration
columns.description: If the object expiration is configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the response includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id key-value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of the rule-id is URL-encoded.

columns.name: expires
columns.description: The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.

columns.name: etag
columns.description: The entity tag of the object.

columns.name: object_lock_legal_hold_status
columns.description: Like a retention period, a legal hold prevents an object version from being overwritten or deleted. A legal hold remains in effect until removed.

columns.name: object_lock_mode
columns.description: The Object Lock mode currently in place for this object.

columns.name: object_lock_retain_until_date
columns.description: The date and time when this object's Object Lock will expire.

columns.name: parts_count
columns.description: The count of parts this object has. This value is only returned if you specify partNumber in your request and the object was uploaded as a multipart upload.

columns.name: prefix
columns.description: The prefix of the key of the object.

columns.name: replication_status
columns.description: Amazon S3 can return this if your request involves a bucket that is either a source or destination in a replication rule.

columns.name: request_charged
columns.description: If present, indicates that the requester was successfully charged for the request.

columns.name: restore
columns.description: Provides information about object restoration action and expiration time of the restored object copy.

columns.name: server_side_encryption
columns.description: The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3.

columns.name: size
columns.description: Size in bytes of the object.

columns.name: sse_customer_algorithm
columns.description: If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the response will include this header confirming the encryption algorithm used.

columns.name: sse_customer_key_md5
columns.description: If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption key.

columns.name: sse_kms_key_id
columns.description: If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service(Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that was used for the object.

columns.name: tag_count
columns.description: The number of tags, if any, on the object.

columns.name: website_redirection_location
columns.description: If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this object  to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.

columns.name: acl
columns.description: ACLs define which AWS accounts or groups are granted access along with the type of access.

columns.name: checksum
columns.description: The checksum or digest of the object.

columns.name: metadata
columns.description: A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.

columns.name: object_parts
columns.description: A collection of parts associated with a multipart upload.

columns.name: owner
columns.description: The owner of the object.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags assigned to the object.

columns.name: region
columns.description: The AWS Region in which the object is located.
